answers.answer: Prostatitis is certainly a possibility - and sometimes require an extended course of antibiotics (sometimes lasting 4-12 weeks)I would repeat a physical exam to determine if tenderness is still there.  Urinalysis and culture should also be done.  If there continues to be concern about prostatitis, prostatic fluid can be expressed and sent.A transrectal ultrasound can be considered to image the prostate for any abscesses.  If this is the case, then antibiotics would not be helpful, and draining of the abscess would be needed.These options should be discussed with your urologist.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.http://www.straightfromthedoc.com
